title: Grades 9-12
subject: Illinois Standards Aligned Instruction for Libraries (I-SAIL) (2022-)

document.title: ILLINOIS STANDARDS ALIGNED INSTRUCTION FOR LIBRARIES

3DA49EDAAA464822A282AC814A8C0360.description:
Participate in discussions about literature to share
opinions and consider other perspectives

2AE3E9B3DD88423097F8FE9491D6BFB7.description:
Read and listen to literature which expands the reader's
own background knowledge and gives unique
perspectives on different experiences outside of the
reader's own

CDBD2A4C2CA142A99883EC5267C062A1.description:
Read and listen to literature on diverse reading and
award lists

871CA2E168584B3A84773C12DA970AD6.description: Read and listen to literature from diverse perspectives

16E11DEF698F4CA8BDDE6A57828B0346.description:
EMPATHIZE: Read to understand
perspectives
outside one’s own

A085EE8544CB4D17A65FADD5773251F4.description: Select resources and materials based on interest or need

E118AA0C89744C91B1EC422432C7D478.description: Seek information related to personal interests

3F14AECC9536491C8BC0AA7158FC9989.description:
Cultivate a love of reading and become a self-motivated
reader

504426DB89DB416BA60FFECD92D89D66.description:
Access libraries, library staff, and library resources both
personally and virtually

65DB77E4A68E455388492EB3C4F369D3.description:
Derive meaning from informational texts in various
formats

F464138E55B145D593AFE1A64B8A9962.description:
DEVELOP: Cultivate a personal
reading identity

B8D0164F0B484E478C8AFA353C130E6F.description:
Understand information presented creatively in various
non-textual formats

AA8DA7CD918F4C5F99A8DF5979570EE3.description:
Distinguish between different types and elements of
literature

7B927F7AC99E4D25B99790EBA96A4E1F.description:
Self-select reading material appropriate for a specific
purpose

1A3DE65F61724AA98B6C3A329AD737CF.description:
Learn about various literary awards to help guide
personal reading selections

7058867956834F2FBA88C59CD3058B00.description:
Read and listen to stories from a wide range of genres,
formats, and topics

B260238F1AC3463483E1815104FE8399.description:
EXPLORE: Select different
formats, genres and
topics of literature

63BD6126F08E4CE682B66A88555B2114.description: Use both text and visuals to understand literature

EB454C791EE04D07AED6183DD8E8F2FE.description:
Refine individual taste in series, author, and genre
reading

286D9D2697684D0887317EC4E02D8476.description:
Appreciate information presented creatively in various
formats

F3DF507C9FB143F888EE7A544722AB95.description:
Read and listen to stories for enjoyment, entertainment,
education, personal interest, and other benefits

725AD252C6574EEEA2F11985DA63B17D.description:
APPRECIATE: Understand the
benefits of reading

2DB95E637BA0421C8A0898F47AFFA41A.description:
INDIVIDUAL LITERACY: Promote the appreciation of literature and its impact on an
individual as a foundation of lifelong learning, the development
of empathy, and an appreciation for the diverse, vibrant world in
which we live

6FA646E2F9E54A1C8F6C56F218C2DEB5.description:
Explain the mental, physical, and emotional consequences of
online activities

579FA15F26A94F97AE487B1DEBA059C3.description:
Recognize that networked environments are public places
governed by codes of ethical behavior

7AA8A3720919437287A785BC95C532CC.description:
Understand the rationale for and steps to observe copyright
and fair use guidelines

329594C9DCD24518AC573EAE20D3DB71.description:
RESPECT: Recognize how
actions impact
others online

7D5D894EBC344AB2BD0DF905DD510228.description:
Recognize the effects of inappropriate online behavior
(harassment, cyberbullying, threats, etc.) and demonstrate
methods to report such incidents

63B07DEF04FC4CABB109CEE9FACAAC85.description:
Recognize and avoid potentially damaging or invasive
content (malware, phishing scams, viruses, etc.) by using
appropriate filters and antivirus software

8995C75AD5B345299528419FFAC1B189.description:
Read and comprehend Acceptable Use Policies (AUP),
privacy policies, and terms of use agreements

A53BDBD669C24572A8687242BA459104.description:
Understand the basics of online consumerism, potential
threats, and understand steps to take in order to protect
online accounts and information (identity theft, security,
fraud, phishing, etc.)

70C5671893B3461E9CF4A28C1769B3E1.description:
Identify ways to make accounts and information private to
unknown online entities

B2598B86C177411ABEBFA22A8AB368DA.description:
PROTECT: Understand and
secure identity
and information

DCC9384AAA5344978578253DC844AAFB.description:
Acknowledge and consider the potential permanent
consequences of posting personal information online

26677722D8DC45B2B25FAB3A3334E69D.description:
Understand what constitutes personal information and all the
ways in which personal information can be shared (social
media, text messages, email, blogging, gaming apps etc.)

021732699E0F4338847933BBD23F74DB.description:
Foster a positive online reputation and abstain from
inappropriate or illegal online behavior

0C8490CE5EE748FE827920C4E891D9A0.description:
PARTICIPATE: Act responsibly
in a digital
environment

FB882681C9DF4F9CAECF0C948AEF978F.description:
When sharing content give credit for the ideas of others that
you choose to share

50E6CBC94C1743ED986AE454B6459202.description: Choose platforms appropriate for intended goals

5A926F5ADFFC4F08A0D220F5542D47E3.description:
Choose platforms appropriate for the information being
conveyed

B9289AF138A74CA48BEFC3F35894E6CA.description:
Use the Internet responsibly to locate information and
communicate with others safely

9143A40BFDE7477196F9B690DF8E7164.description:
DIGITAL LITERACY: Understand the impact of an online presence to yourself and others
while maintaining privacy and security practices

10E6C33CD184451CAEFB13F278240733.description:
Evaluate final product or presentation based on
audience feedback

430794C02B9546E1922D6F831B72FF63.description:
Use problem-solving techniques to devise strategies for
revising and improving process and product

D77447E0F486436D8CACE6596A9C168C.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of the platform used to
present information

1AD3D2705D3C4DD5812F9661692944AE.description:
Reflect on how personal bias informs the way we
communicate media, online and offline, and the
communication circles in which we participate

776D894A17C243F08CC3E0BD41F97C5E.description:
SHARE: Consider the
intention and
impact of shared
media

90C0A5040BC44B3EAED84B85329F1E77.description:
Learn and use technology tools, online environments,
and other collaborative tools to share information

783ACE949C194264BDFAD8A4E2022B82.description:
Present, perform, or share information and ideas
successfully and appropriately

6DE2546819094493B368F3C6604489FB.description:
Select an appropriate format and forum for
communicating ideas

4F80BC7E620848A98AE850A965321E77.description:
COMMUNICATE: Share media
effectively with an
intended audience

BD6EB20392A44C839154D86C87BCA538.description:
Learn and use technology tools, online environments,
and other collaborative tools to create messages
through a variety of platforms (videos, slides, essays,
websites, podcasts, etc)

A8F3D5B247EE43669A3B15DBD71BE4AD.description:
Collaborate with others to select, organize, and
integrate information and ideas from various sources
and formats

E685B3EB63074D71A929A9F196C14EB8.description:
Combine ideas and information to develop and
demonstrate new understanding

C070B4F61FD842E7B396C9359C55E296.description:
Use purposeful and appropriate resources and
technology in creating products

54C3852FA0924527929D99B52BB6CCA3.description:
Produce and communicate information and ideas in
appropriate formats and in appropriate forums, both
online and offline

46326C5DB9E0475ABDD1E0336EAFDFB5.description: Create a product that clearly expresses ideas

4C8D8EAE1B6846BDA5360AA93F4A65C9.description: Develop a formal outline or storyboard

6287C13D1838448C91906CA8BA161677.description:
Integrate new information into new schema to meet
individual learning needs

5BF1C0B5B6CA4C5BBB4909025CB4C324.description:
CREATE: Use media
thoughtfully and
purposefully

6C1355A1BB2D41F994DAFCC4412615AD.description:
Utilize effective strategies to analyze truthfulness, such
as triangulation and lateral reading

3C54287F80A94DE39AE82816AEDF1270.description:
Use paraphrasing, highlighting, and other extraction
techniques or strategies to identify and record relevant
information

7226F42D58EE4D6CBF7DA8C782D616FE.description:
Identify main, supporting, and conflicting information
using multiple sources to support interpretation or point
of view

A607CBE3551E4331AB09DB0D8FBECE62.description:
Critically examine and analyze relevant information from
various sources to discover relationships and patterns
among ideas

4B1CE4D5A70D45EAB093818763E5A85F.description:
Apply evaluative criteria to print and/or nonprint
materials to determine the relative value of the
information: relevancy, suitability, authority, objectivity,
currency

02E2D17C60264562A4028B23A6F578C5.description:
Organize information for practical application and in
logical sequence

3380CA9D424E48CAB2B5494743120038.description:
Recognize fact, bias, point of view, and opinion as
presented in media

E723B05B502D48588A64BDF103C35C41.description:
ANALYZE &
EVALUATE: Establish and apply
criteria to determine
diverse, balanced
resources

F6A6F25A45DE4F19887EE60EBBCA2AA8.description:
MEDIA LITERACY: Analyze, evaluate, create, and communicate using a variety of
objective forms responsibly, including, but not limited to, print,
visual, audio, interactive, and digital formats (Illinois Public Act
102-0055)

2AF16A87346B4AC699D6663542DFBD4E.description:
Understand and respect the concepts of intellectual
freedom, intellectual property, copyright, and plagiarism

63BC2CFCB9DD4D4694DB30D999DEE42B.description:
Use paraphrasing, summarizing, and quoting to give
credit to any ideas that are not completely original

4B2A08F61B154FA9A6B3C838D6A0CD91.description:
Cite all print and nonprint sources according to style
formats effectively and independently

9A53A71ACDA54EADAD38CD08CE4EF249.description:
CURATE: Organize and cite
resources to fulfill
an informational
need

FBF21734338C461E9F3791839D3601DD.description:
Employ advanced features of library catalog and other
databases, such as boolean searching

6E6733A7367547998071CCE93A267F88.description:
Consider scope, depth, and accessibility of materials to
efficiently select resources most appropriate for
information need

A17CBDA1F999454D969FE39319801B99.description:
Identify and use various strategies and techniques to
execute and refine successful searches

97D0EA395D004306BBF305F1C1081472.description:
ACCESS &
SEARCH: Find resources to
address an
informational need

3799FF3270804D3BB4EE6740D0FF61A2.description:
Synthesize diverse resources in order to convey an
organized message

048197DF7C244E02A83AD26546A48E61.description:
Create a purpose or thesis statement to define an
information need and use search strategies to identify
resources and locate information

15B2C8061D8F4F0DA9C4099E84D7A586.description:
RESEARCH &
EXPLORE: Establish a process
for finding
information

2958E0D88E7F484B9DD034F5C89A4412.description:
Formulate a question to guide research based on goals
and outcomes that will meet required expectations or
inquiry goals

7655AECB162143E7BAEFAD92F86D7A64.description:
INQUIRE: Articulate a sense of
wonder and
curiosity

A4072C6395F1490EA18CF1AD361AD110.description:
INFORMATION LITERACY: Access information efficiently and effectively to inquire, think
critically, and gain knowledge through the research process
